alert.note: Alert for Lee (Iowa) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Blizzard Warning issued January 12 at 2:42AM CST until January 13 at 12:00PM CST by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM CST THIS AFTERNOON... ...BLIZZARD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM 5 PM THIS AFTERNOON TO NOON CST SATURDAY... ...WIND CHILL WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SATURDAY EVENING THROUGH TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...For the Winter Weather Advisory, mixed precipitation. Additional snow accumulations after daybreak of 2 to 4 inches and ice accumulations of a light glaze. Winds gusting as high as 40 mph. For the Blizzard Warning, blizzard conditions with blowing snow expected tonight and Saturday morning. Northwest winds gusting as high as 50 mph today. For the Wind Chill Watch, dangerously cold wind chills possible. Wind chills as low as 40 below zero. * WHERE...Lee County. * WHEN...For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 5 PM CST this afternoon. For the Blizzard Warning, from 5 PM this afternoon to noon CST Saturday. For the Wind Chill Watch, from Saturday evening through Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions today. Travel will become very difficult to impossible tonight with significant blowing and drifting snow leading to occasional whiteout conditions. The hazardous conditions will impact this morning and evening commutes. Gusty winds could bring down tree branches, and lead to isolated power outages. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as ten minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Rain and possibly brief freezing rain will mix with snow at times this morning, before cold air and strong winds move in changing the precipitation back to all snow. This evening, much colder air moves in which could result in a flash freeze on roadways.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Travel should be restricted to emergencies only. If you must travel, have a winter survival kit with you. If you get stranded, stay with your vehicle. Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
